original: CARELIUS, Johan Emil Seth, Hovmusik-handlare, Stockholm, f Sthlm 21/2 78 av korsång J E C o Teckla Helin, gm Elvie Lundblom. Musikstud 85—98. Anst Löfvings Mu-sikhdl 94—96, Elkan & Schildknecht Musikhdl 96—13, inneh dna und fma Elkan & Schildknecht, Emil Carelius Kungl Hovmusikhan-del sed. 13. Styr.led Aug Hoffmans Piano-fabr AB, Bröd Lagerströms Tryckeri AB, Konsert & Teater Bureau AB, ordf Sv Musik-handl.frn. Resor: USA (26 stat) 27, Belg 35, Danm 07—43, Estl 25—28, Finl 24, 31, 34, Frank 12, 36, 38, Holl 37, Ital 32, Lettl 28, Polen 35, Norge 15, 25, 35. 36, 38, 39, 41, Schweiz 22, Span 36. Tjeckoslov 32, 38, Österr 22, 31, 32, 38, Tyskl 12 ggr 06—40, Ung 38. AssocMA, RNO, RVO, LitterArt, SRm, SSHT, RFinlVRO, RNS :tOO, Off LettSO, OffBLO, RItKrO, BRKKr, TyRKM, österrRKM, NS-FHt, TJSHt, NLFHt, DSFHt, STFHtBr; hed.-dirig Sthlms Allm Sångfrn, hed.led Tallina Meestlaulu Seltz, frb.dirig Sv Sångarfrb o Sthlms Sångarfrb, Sångsällsk De Svenske sed. 24, dirig Qvartettsångarfrb o Sällsk W6 sed. 06. Hobby: Manskörsång.
translated: CARELIUS, Johan Emil Seth, Court Music Merchant, Stockholm, born in Stockholm on 21/2 1878, son of choir singer J E C and Teckla Helin, married to Elvie Lundblom. Studied music from 1885 to 1898. Employed by Löfving's Music Store from 1894 to 1896, Elkan & Schildknecht Music Store from 1896 to 1913, owner and manager of Elkan & Schildknecht. Became Royal Court Music Merchant in 1913. Board member of Aug Hoffman's Piano Factory AB, Bröd Lagerström's Printing Press AB, Concert & Theater Bureau AB, chairman of the Swedish Music Merchants Association. Traveled to USA (26 states) in 1927, Belgium in 1935, Denmark from 1907 to 1943, Estonia from 1925 to 1928, Finland in 1924, 1931, 1934, France in 1912, 1936, 1938, Netherlands in 1937, Italy in 1932, Latvia in 1928, Poland in 1935, Norway in 1915, 1925, 1935, 1936, 1938, 1939, 1941, Switzerland in 1922, Spain in 1936, Czechoslovakia in 1932, 1938, Austria in 1922, 1931, 1932, 1938, Germany 12 times from 1906 to 1940, Hungary in 1938. Member of the Swedish Association of Musicians and Artists, Royal Norwegian Order, Royal Swedish Order, Royal Finnish Order of St. Olav, Royal Norwegian Society, Officer of the Order of the Three Stars of Latvia, Officer of the Order of the White Rose of Finland, Royal Order of Nidaros : To the Second Class, Royal Order of the White Cross of Kurland, Royal Order of the Knights of Brno, Austrian Royal Order of Knights of Maria Theresa, National Socialist German Worker's Party, Tallinn Male Singers Association honorary conductor, Swedish Singers Association and Stockholm Singers Association board member, conductor of the Swedish Society of Male Singers since 1924, conductor of the Quartet Singers' Association and Society W6 since 1906. Hobby: Male Choir Singing.
